exhibition.description: 강서경의 개인전 '마치'는 시간, 공간, 그리고 개인적 뿌리내림의 주제를 탐구합니다. 작가는 전통 한국 악보에서 영감을 받은 격자 기반 구성을 사용하며, '정(Jeong)' (공간적 틀)과 '모라(Mora)' (시간의 단위)에 집중하여 개인적 시간과 계절적 전환을 검토하는 신작 회화와 조각을 선보입니다.
exhibition.description_en: Suki Seokyeong Kang's solo exhibition 'MARCH' explores themes of time, space, and individual rootedness through her unique conceptual approach. She uses grid-based compositions inspired by traditional Korean musical notation and focuses on 'Jeong' (spatial framework) and 'Mora' (unit of time), presenting new paintings and sculptures that examine personal time and seasonal transitions.

artists.name: Suki Seokyeong Kang
education: Korean Painting at Ewha Womans University
Painting at Royal College of Art
artists.current_position: Professor of Korean Painting at Ewha Womans University
artists.artistic_approach: Reinterpreting traditional Korean cultural elements through contemporary art

exhibition.curatorial_statement: Exploring individual rootedness through spatial and temporal frameworks, translating personal and historical narratives through innovative representations

jeong.source: Grid system inspired by traditional Korean musical notation

mora.definition: Temporal unit representing painting's narrative layers
mora.concept: Unit of time in artistic expression

artistic_techniques.painting_process: Horizontal canvas painting allowing paint to flow naturally
artistic_techniques.paint_flow: Documentation of paint flowing over canvas edges
artistic_techniques.grid_system: Rectangular grids referencing historical musical scores
artistic_techniques.material_integration: Combination of traditional and contemporary materials

title_significance.machi_korean: 마치 (as if, like) - suggesting transformation and resemblance
title_significance.wordplay: Bilingual pun connecting movement and transformation concepts

cultural_context.contemporary_translation: Modern artistic interpretation of historical frameworks
cultural_context.educational_background: Korean painting tradition combined with Western training
cultural_context.institutional_connection: Academic position at Ewha Womans University

exhibition_significance.cultural_bridge: Connecting traditional Korean elements with contemporary art
exhibition_significance.material_experimentation: Integration of diverse traditional and modern materials
